body:

comment_data.body: This seems like a one-off error. Remove ./node_modules and try again.

I get this error when I do npm install mineflayer


npm ERR! ursa@0.8.0 install: `node-gyp configure build && node install.js`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the ursa@0.8.0 install script.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the ursa package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node-gyp configure build && node install.js
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls ursa
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! System Darwin 12.3.0
npm ERR! command "node" "/usr/local/bin/npm" "install" "mineflayer"
npm ERR! cwd /Users/User
npm ERR! node -v v0.10.24
npm ERR! npm -v 1.3.21
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Additional logging details can be found in:
npm ERR!     /Users/User/npm-debug.log
npm ERR! not ok code 0

It also says
xcode-select: Error: No Xcode is selected. Use xcode-select -switch <path-to-xcode>, or see the xcode-select manpage (man xcode-select) for further information.
It's missing Xcode and thus cannot compile ursa, are you sure you have Xcode? And, if you want, I can try giving you my compiled version of ursa for Mac.

No reply for 4 months.

To build mineflayer, you need to be able to build node-minecraft-protocol, which requires the native module ursa. To build ursa you need to be able to build an MSVC project.

In the case of OSX, as @justin97530 said. You require XCode.
If you need assistance with building ursa we can help, but the best port of call would be https://github.com/Medium/ursa

Cheers. Closed. Comment if you feel this needs re-opening.

title: Error on installation(On Mac)
